intro: Phyllonoma weberbaueri, commonly known as the Weberbauer's phyllonoma, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Its leaves are lanceolate and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Phyllonoma weberbaueri is often found in rocky or mountainous habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soil conditions.
